update.description:
Apologies for the huge pull request. Changing the root of an inheritance tree causes changes to all children.

In this pull request:

1. Opaque data pointers in Sensor and children of Sensor. Take a look at `SensorPrivate.hh`. There are two classes: `SensorProtected` and `SensorPrivate`. The Protected version captures attributes that were `protected:` in `Sensor.hh`, and the Private version captures attributes that were `private:` in `Sensor.h``.

2. Removed the prefix `Get` from function names.

I'm working on the migration guide and change log.

[Jenkins no-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/910/) which had failing test that was fixed.
update.title: Pimpl Sensor heirarchy

content.raw: Agreed. In this case, I didn't feel the need to create a separate class for the `private: bool rendered` value.
content.html: Agreed. In this case, I didn't feel the need to create a separate class for the private: bool rendered value.

content.raw:
That's what I did in pull request #2033. I can't think of a drawback to it, and it makes things simpler.

#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2033/pimplize-gui-building-item/diff#Lgazebo/gui/building/RectItem.hhF235

content.raw: or maybe just assume everything here in `CameraSensorPrivate` is protected and don't bother splitting this private class.
content.html: or maybe just assume everything here in CameraSensorPrivate is protected and don't bother splitting this private class.

content.raw: just to confirm, if I create a class that inherits from `CameraSensor`, I would need to split this `CameraSensorPrivate` class and move protected variables to `CameraSensorProtected`?
content.html: just to confirm, if I create a class that inherits from CameraSensor, I would need to split this CameraSensorPrivate class and move protected variables to CameraSensorProtected?

content.raw: is this note correct? I see that this is from gazebo6 and the type has already been updated to `SensorNoiseType` in `default` branch
content.html: is this note correct? I see that this is from gazebo6 and the type has already been updated to SensorNoiseType in default branch
